alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 4:22AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A DANGEROUS SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN YUMA AND EASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTIES... At 421 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Wray to near Bethune to 14 miles southwest of Burlington. Movement was east at 10 mph. Wind gusts up to 50 mph are possible with this dangerous squall. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Wray, Bonny Reservoir, Bethune, Beecher Island, Vernon, and Hale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 427 and 449. Highway 385 between mile markers 170 and 250. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this dangerous squall. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
